intro: Matayba cristae, commonly known as the cristate matayba, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. Matayba cristae is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
